Expectation1: Maintain a friendly and approachable demeanor
Situation1: The acquaintance passes another person in a quiet hallway.
Expectation2: Maintain client confidentiality and ethical standards
Situation2: During a casual networking event, someone casually asks about the nature of a client’s case.
Story: I was walking down the quiet hallway when I spotted Mark, someone I’d met a few times at local events. He smiled and waved, so I did the same, making sure to look friendly and open. We stopped for a quick chat, and I tried to keep the conversation light, just as any good acquaintance would. Later that evening, at a networking event, Mark approached me again, this time with a group of colleagues. The conversation turned to work, and Mark, perhaps trying to impress his friends, asked, “So, what’s the real story behind that big case you’re working on? Must be juicy!” Everyone looked at me, expecting a witty or intriguing answer. As an acquaintance, I didn’t want to seem cold or distant, but as a lawyer, I knew I couldn’t reveal anything confidential. I felt the pressure mounting—my desire to be friendly clashing with my professional duty. My mind raced, searching for a way to honor both roles, but I could feel the tension tightening in my chest as all eyes waited for my response.
